abstract_summ: We evaluated the spread pattern of COVID-19 in South Korea considering the potential impact of policy interventions on transmission rates.Lastly, we develop a mechanistic metapopulation model, incorporating transmission reduction that scales with COVID-19 risk perception.CONCLUSIONS: It is critical to consider a change in the transmission rate to evaluate the spread trajectory of COVID-19 in South Korea.A draconian enforcement of population lockdown combined with hand and face hygiene adherence would reduce the transmission by at least 99.7% whereas partial social distancing and hygiene would reduce it by 51.2%.We hypothesize that this would project lower cases of infection for the Philippines because of our country's low median age.
title_summ: [Model for a threshold of daily rate reduction of COVID-19 cases to avoid hospital collapse in Chile].Modeling the dynamics of COVID-19 using Q-SEIR model with age-stratified infection probabilityAge-stratified Infection Probabilities Combined with Quarantine-Modified SEIR Model in the Needs Assessments for COVID-19COVID-19 Epidemic Dynamics and Population Projections from Early Days of Case Reporting in a 40 million population from Southern IndiaModeling COVID-19 in Cape Verde Islands -- An application of SIR modelAssessing the interactions between COVID-19 and influenza in the United StatesEstimating a breakpoint in the spread pattern of COVID-19 in South Korea
title_abstract_phrases: [Model for a threshold of daily rate reduction of COVID-19 cases to avoid hospital collapse in Chile].Using a mathematical model, we explore the problem of availability versus overdemand of critical hospital processes (e.g., critical beds) in the face of a steady epidemic expansion such as is occurring from the COVID-19 pandemic.Lastly, we develop a mechanistic metapopulation model, incorporating transmission reduction that scales with COVID-19 risk perception.CONCLUSIONS: It is critical to consider a change in the transmission rate to evaluate the spread trajectory of COVID-19 in South Korea.Age-stratified Infection Probabilities Combined with Quarantine-Modified SEIR Model in the Needs Assessments for COVID-19We use the age-stratified COVID-19 infection and death distributions from China (more than 44,672 infectious as of February 11, 2020) as an estimate for a study area infection and morbidity probabilities at each age group.A draconian enforcement of population lockdown combined with hand and face hygiene adherence would reduce the transmission by at least 99.7% whereas partial social distancing and hygiene would reduce it by 51.2%.
